docs.snippet: Chinese authorities have ordered video streaming websites in the country to stop showing four popular American TV shows, including "The Big Bang Theory" and "The Good Wife," representatives from two sites said Sunday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Chinese authorities have ordered video streaming websites in the country to stop showing four popular American TV shows, including "The Big Bang Theory" and "The Good Wife," representatives from two sites said Sunday.

headline.main: 4 US TV Shows Ordered Off Chinese Websites
headline.print_headline: 4 US TV Shows Ordered Off Chinese Websites

docs.snippet: Steven Wise is arguing for the legal “personhood” of chimps and other animals. And no one is laughing him out of the courtroom....
docs.lead_paragraph: Steven Wise is arguing for the legal “personhood” of chimps and other animals. And no one is laughing him out of the courtroom.
docs.abstract: Steven Wise, legal scholar in the field of animal law, and the Nonhuman Rights Project have filed suit on behalf of a chimpanzee and argued for legal personhood for chimps; group plans to file similar suits on behalf of other members of the great ape family.

headline.main: Should a Chimp Be Able to Sue Its Owner?

docs.snippet: Regulators may be starting to circle, but in Oklahoma, the e-cigarette industry is going full steam ahead....
docs.lead_paragraph: Regulators may be starting to circle, but in Oklahoma, the e-cigarette industry is going full steam ahead.
docs.abstract: E-cigarette business is booming, with some 5,000 'vape' shops opening nationwide, and trend has been particularly robust in Oklahoma; industry has benefited from state's high concentration of smokers who are desperate to quit, and from low cost of starting a business; expansion has proceeded despite growing attention of regulators (Series: The New Smoke).

headline.main: Where Vapor Comes Sweeping Down the Plain

docs.snippet: Nearly 40 years ago, a Native American activist turned up dead, and still no one knows who was responsible. She had a lot of enemies, but her friends may have been more dangerous....
docs.lead_paragraph: Nearly 40 years ago, a Native American activist turned up dead, and still no one knows who was responsible. She had a lot of enemies, but her friends may have been more dangerous.
docs.abstract: Eric Konigsberg article details murder of American Indian Movement activist Anna Mae Pictou Aquash in 1976, saying still no one knows who was responsible; notes crime has over the last decade been established as the work of other AIM members who believed she was an FBI informant; says effect of revelation on Aquash's compatriots has been unsettling.
